intro: Lasiopetalum acutiflorum var. quinquenervium, commonly known as the Five-veined Bower Vine, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The species features small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have five distinct veins, giving it the varietal name "quinquenervium." This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
